Class Interpolation

Namespace
Vts.Common.Math

Vts.dll

Provides methods for interpolation of data in 1D and 2D

Methods

interp1(IList<double>, IList<double>, IEnumerable<double>)

Interpolation in one dimension (assumes x are monotonically increasing)

public static IEnumerable<double> interp1(IList<double> x, IList<double> y, IEnumerable<double> xs)

Parameters

x IList<double>

The known independent values

y IList<double>

The known dependent values

xs IEnumerable<double>

Value to at which to interpolate

Returns

IEnumerable<double>

If xs outside range of x, returns NaN, otherwise, returns linearly interpolated result

interp1(IList<double>, IList<double>, double)

Interpolation in one dimension (assumes x are monotonically increasing)

public static double interp1(IList<double> x, IList<double> y, double xi)

Parameters

x IList<double>

The known dependent values

y IList<double>

The known independent values

xi double

Value to at which to interpolate

Returns

double

If xi outside range of x, it returns the appropriate boundary value

interp1(IList<double>, double[,], IEnumerable<double>, int, int)

Interpolation in one dimension within a 2-dimensional array of values

public static IEnumerable<double> interp1(IList<double> x, double[,] y, IEnumerable<double> xs, int fixedDimension, int fixedIndex)

Parameters

x IList<double>

The known independent value

y double[,]

The known dependent value

xs IEnumerable<double>

Value to at which to interpolate

fixedDimension int

The dimension of y in which to interpolate

fixedIndex int

The index within the dimension of y in which to interpolate

Returns

IEnumerable<double>

If xs outside range of x, returns NaN, otherwise, returns linearly interpolated result as an IEnumerable of type double

interp1(IList<double>, double[,], double, int, int)

Interpolation in one dimension (assumes x are monotonically increasing) of 2D array over either 1st or 2nd dimension with fixed index in other dimension

public static double interp1(IList<double> x, double[,] y, double xi, int fixedDimension, int fixedIndex)

Parameters

x IList<double>

The known dependent values

y double[,]

The known independent values

xi double

Value to at which to interpolate

fixedDimension int

Dimension of 2D array to keep fixed

fixedIndex int

Fixed index of dim

Returns

double

The interpolated value (clamped to boundary values if xi are of range)

interp1(IList<float>, float[,], float, int, int)

Interpolation in one dimension (assumes x are monotonically increasing) of 2D array over either 1st or 2nd dimension with fixed index in other dimension

public static float interp1(IList<float> x, float[,] y, float xi, int fixedDimension, int fixedIndex)

Parameters

x IList<float>

The known dependent values

y float[,]

The known independent values

xi float

Value to at which to interpolate

fixedDimension int

Dimension of 2D array to keep fixed

fixedIndex int

Fixed index of dim

Returns

float

The interpolated value (clamped to boundary values if xi are of range)

interp2(IList<double>, IList<double>, double[,], double, double)

Interpolation in two dimensions

public static double interp2(IList<double> x, IList<double> y, double[,] f, double xi, double yi)

Parameters

x IList<double>

The known independent values

y IList<double>

The known independent values

f double[,]

The known dependent values

xi double

x value to at which to interpolate

yi double

y value to at which to interpolate

Returns

double

The interpolated value (clamped to boundary values if xi are of range)

Remarks

Assumptions: 1) x and y are monotonically increasing, and 2) xi and yi are inclusive to x and y respectively for interpolated results, otherwise return NaN
